Sutra of the Spells of the Illusionist Ajiu, 1 fascicle RatnagotravibhÄga MahÄyÄna-Uttaratantra-ÅšÄstra, 4 fascicles RatnakÅ«á¹­a-sÅ«tra-Å›Ästra, 4 fascicles The three texts below the story of the illusionist, nine fascicles

The Sutra of the Samadhi of Pure Salvation in three fascicles, the Dharma Society Sutra in two fascicles, the Sutra of the Vairocana Samadhi in two fascicles, the Sutra on Determining Merit and Demerit in one fascicle, the Sutra on Saving Lives and Relieving Human Suffering and Distress in one fascicle, the Sutra of Beneficial Intent in two fascicles, the Sutra of the Most Wonderful and Supreme in one fascicle, the Sutra on the Samadhi of Avalokitesvara in one fascicle, the Sutra on the Practice of Pure Dharma in one fascicle, and the Sutra of Avalokitesvara of the High King in one fascicle - these ten sutras in fifteen fascicles.
They are all sutras of doubtful authenticity from ancient catalogs.
Although the Zhou catalog included them in the canon,
the text and reasoning are all mixed with human contrivances.
Therefore, this catalog excludes them and does not list them. There are a total of 116 works in 142 fascicles.
Many of them are found in the current canon of various catalogs.
Now, because they are all redundant,
some have been sought but not obtained.
Therefore, they are not included in the definitive canon. Fearing that the details may not be known, I have briefly described them.
If you wish to know the details,
they are all extensively described in the Eliminating Prolixity Catalog.
Kaiyuan Record of the Buddhist Teachings, Scroll 20, Abridged Separate Record, Scroll 4
